qas.question: When could record album covers first be found?
What were early record album covers made of?

answers.text: empty sleeves with a paperboard or leather cover

qas.question: What sizes were record album covers available in?
How were record album covers intended to be stored?
What was the purpose of record album covers?

context: By about <a0_0>1910<a0_0/>,[note 1] bound collections of <a1_0>empty sleeves with a paperboard or leather cover<a1_0/>, similar to a photograph album, were sold as record albums that customers could use to store their records (the term "record album" was printed on some covers). These albums came in both <a2_0>10-inch and 12-inch sizes<a2_0/>. The covers of these bound books were wider and taller than the records inside, allowing the record album to be placed on a shelf <a3_0>upright<a3_0/>, like a book, suspending the fragile records above the shelf and <a4_0>protecting them<a4_0/>.
